duties_responsibilities.duty: Serve as a subject matter expert as it relates to all product & service offerings of the credit union.
Assist members and associates via multiple channels which includes but is not limited to phone, video, chat, email, etc.
Perform quality assurance monitoring for the Member Advisors to ensure services levels are meeting and/or exceeding member and credit union expectations.
Assist with supervision of Member Advisor staff, act as Team Leader for a group of ten to twelve Member Advisors.
Maintain a highly motivated, well-trained staff and evaluate job performance within designated time frames to ensure quality of work and service to members and staff.
Assist with the development of department goals and objectives for designated staff.
Assist with the development and updates of departmental procedures.
Responsible for continued development of the training program(s) as it relates to the designated staff.
Consistently monitor various member service contact points to ensure prescribed service levels are achieved.
Lead daily meetings with team to disseminate information, perform skill-practice and provide recognition.
Assist in the recruiting process by attending interviews and recommending candidates for employment.
Perform PAT settlement and troubleshooting as assigned.
Prepare pertinent month-end reports as required.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, or related field
